So how do I say this without sounding like the most horrible person. I sometimes feel like I am quite possibly the worst Christian on the face of the planet. However I do not feel any guilt or remorse about this because there is peace. I have not talked to my mother in over 3 weeks and she has been calling trying to get in touch with me. I have not returned a phone call or e-mail and I don't want to. There is a fear that lies beneath in my soul that I can not think about. There is a heaviness and a darkness that burdens me everytime I think about talking to my mother. Why? Why? Why? I want to love and respect her, I want to cherish her, I want to honor her as the Lord would call me to do but I can't. I think that I can honestly say without a question that I do not love my mother. I don't respect her deicisions, her advice, the way she treats everyone including me. I don't respect her as a mother because she has done an absolutely horrible job. I don't respect her advice and the way she expresses herself in all situations. I do not cherish anything about her. Cherish would imply to value highly, to hold dear and I don't value her as a person, as an adult grown woman, as a parent, a wife, or a friend. The thing that I have the hardest time with is the honor part, she doesn't honor anyone in any definition of the word. How do you give honor to someone that does not deserve it at all. How do I justify my feelings towards my mother when it explicitely goes against everything that I am called to. The fear that I speak of is the fact that I was once just like her. I was angry and violent towards people and the world in general. I was confrontational and aggressive when things were not done my way. I was a horrible person to everyone, family, friends, people I didn't know. I don't ever want to be like that again, I want to be bigger than all of those things that hinder me and build a wall between God and I. My mother's wall is still a million feet high. She won't let anyone in and when she does they are lies. She won't put anyone first because it does not advantage her. There is no gain in giving of herself so she doesn't do it even though she thinks she does and will be irrationally angry if you don't see it. I hate the person she is and all she does is help me to put myself right back in that place of contempt. She is the only person on the face of this planet that can get me right to that edge where I used to lose it. She is the only person that can still drive me to a rage that is uncontrolable. She is the only person that I would hit because of my anger and her complete disregard for anyone but herself. She has lied to me, stole form me, and beat me down so much that I can't do it anymore. She has lied to my sisters and given them false hope that she will actually be the mother that they yearn for. She has badmouthed my father, blamed the entire divorce on him, and criticized him to me. I really think that she thinks that I was to young to really understand what was happening. I think that she really believes that I didn't see her affair, her abusiveness of my dad, and her lack of attention to my sisters and I. She sees me as a 12 year old kid that doesn't know what I am talking about. I can't watch her treat my sisters the way that she does, and I can't listen to her blatantly lie about my father not only to me but people that don't even know my father. I can't do it anymore. These last 3 weeks have been so peaceful. I have been able to focus 100% on my marriage, family other than my immediate, school, and work. She calls every night and the dread rises in my throat. I honestly have this feeling of nasea every time I think about talking to her or listening to her crap. I really don't know what to do about it. I have prayed that God would change my heart and I would be an example. I truly think that I have been however nothing has changed and it has literally been 4 years. I am tired, I am drained, and I am weary of her. I can't do it anymore.

Noise noise is that rumbling in your head deafening in your soul it's the place between serenity and chaos the environment where you find ideas you don't need to search for them in noise they are just there being thrown and tossed waiting to be caught and used creativity is in the idea conversation, voices, and emotion all of which you can touch sensation and feelings course through your blood on the tip of your tongue you savor it the noise has texture and taste you can smell it as it passes by you every ounce of aroma filling your nostrils watch it take shape expression, body language, and movement the serenity in noise is your own personal chaos you can block out all other noise and the chaos in your head is it's own being the chaos is when you can't find the serenity when all you want is silence and it blares and rings like a gong then the noise evolves and it makes sense, sometimes at times you can translate it carries clarity and annunciation however you stare dumfounded mouth agape trying to understand wanting to know and not miss the noise then you scream in fear and frustration the chaos in the noise is disturbing the serenity that you found interrupting your own personal chaos the ideas that you caught are gone vanished in the unwelcome noise the noise that once inspired now sealed shut the chaos that was once clear is now just chaos, only chaos confusing, annoying, demeaning you plead for the serenity demanding it's return wanting more than anything to throw the ideas you have left back in the noise realizing you never wanted them these were not the ones you wanted to grasp the noise decieved you talked you into the very thing you didn't desire then you realize it wasn't the noise it was you listening and hearing the wrong voice translating and trying to understand the wrong voice in that moment you want to go back yearning for a second chance to hear to listen and decipher and you cry and sob filled with despair as you begin to realize a second chance isn't coming the noise comes again this time you hear more thoroughly you listen more carefully and intuitively and this time you hear it the voice you wanted to hear the first time the ideas that you longed to catch realizing that it never required translation and it didn't need some deep understanding you just needed to drown out the rumbling not let the blaring and ringing take your focus focus on the voice that you want to hear not the voice the noise wants you to hear when you can hear that voice in the midst of the serenity and chaos hold it, catch it, grab it, never loosen your grip and once again the ideas will pour over you taste them in your mouth smell them in your nostrils and they will take shape in you your own personal chaos evolves into serenity the serenity is exciting it draws you to expression which may not always be perfect it will never be perfect but you will try, push forward, and run faster then once again you will find, hear, and listen to the noise in a still small voice

In the Still of the Heart In the still of my heart there is peace that flows like a river. It flows to the quarry that God etched in me before time began. In that quarry there is love like no other. Love that casts down all fears and gives me the wings to soar. Wings to soar where? Wings like the eagle to rise above this hell that I live in. I don't really live there though I put myself there. I really live in a place full of hope and joy. Hope that withstands the test of time. Time that does not exist because it has always been. Existing to be more and more like Him. More like who??? Him who formed me in my mothers womb knitting me together tenderly. My mothers womb where He first gave me life. Gave me life eternally never again to cry or feel pain. Eternity, do you really know how long that is? Stretching my arms as far as they will go, no I don't know how long that is. Arms that open to embrace me dirty, poor, and sinning. Poor, am I really poor? No I am rich I have more wealth than anyone on earth. Wealth that does not tarnish or fade. Does not? Stays pure and bright and full of zeal. Full to the brim with holiness and faithfulness. Am I faithful? Pray without ceasing. Ceasing to envelope myself in this world full of hate. World that He longs to pour compassion and kindness and salvation on. Longing to use me I am his hands and his feet. His hand that his knocking on the door of my heart. The door that is waiting to be opened. Wait on Him and He will renew your strength. Renewing everyday. Everyday joy comes. Everyday? Everyday if you listen in the still of your heart.

Does That Really? I wore a Christian sweatshirt today, does that really show God's love? I wore a WWJD bracelet, does that really show God's salvation? I built a house in Mexico, does that really show God's refuge? I forgave someone their trespasses but held it in my heart, does that really show God's mercy? I was kind to someone in need, does that really show God's grace? I volunteered at the homeless shelter, does that really show God's compassion? I argued with my husband about something pointless, does that really show God's submission? I got into a mindless theological debate, does that really show God's wisdom? Today is October 25th, 2002 and tomorrow will be October 26th, 2002. If you had asked me what is significant about this date 3 years ago I would have looked at you with confusion because I have no idea. It's not a holiday, it's not my birthday or anyone in my family so I probably would have told you nothing. If you ask me today what is significant about October 26th, 2002 I will tell you it is the day that I married Jordan Michael Smith and became his wife. October 26th, 2001 we were married at Vineyard Christian Fellowship in Gilbert , AZ in front of our family and closest friends. October 26th, 2002 it will be one year. Hard and tough? Yes. Fulfilling and blessed? Yes as well. Let me tell you something though, over the course of this year someone told me that if we could make it through the first year we would be just fine. Well here we are and yeah we are going to be just fine. I won't lie to you and tell you everything was roses because I don't want you to have a false sense of what true unity and marriage is. You are going to have conflicts and yep you are going to argue on occasion. If you are that married couple that doesn't may God bless you and keep you that way. Jordan and I however have had our fair share of yelling and arguing but we are here and still together and we love God and each other. So we made it through the first year, I would not say with flying colors, but we made it and I think that as a husband and wife we are better people because of this last year. We have come to a solid ground in our faith as individuals and a couple, we love our families and have made some solid decisions for our own good in regards to them, and we cherish our family in Christ our friends who mean everything to us.

I have not posted in awhile and it really sucks that this is the first thing that I have to say since the last post. Romeo died yesterday. We have had him for a year and a half and he is gone. He was really sick and it had been going on for about a week. He wasn't eating or drinking anything and he was just not himself. He usually would come and love on you and want you to pay attention to him. He would nudge you and rub against you until you would pet him. I would get so annoyed and push him away for whatever reason. Now all I want is for him to come and rub against me, I want him to come and lay on my chest and give me kisses, I want him to roll up in a ball and sleep on the couch and look very serene and beautiful. Romeo was a regal cat he was gorgeous, I had never seen a cat like him. He was black and white it looked like he was wearing a tuxedo with his white chest and black back. He had white socks and a pink nose that was always wet and cold. I think that the most amazing thing about him though was his eyes, he had emerald green eyes and when he had been sitting in the window for a little while with the sun shining in on them and his pupils were constricted you could see straight into the rainforests of Africa. He was the most amazing creature I have ever known. He loved everyone, never ran from anyone even when Hannah would kick him he would come back for more. Cela would always give him attention and he would just basque in it. All the boys (Micah.Grant,Luke,Rodney) were very respectful of him. I would watch him interact with all of my friends and I would truly thank God for the blessing that he was. At night he would come in and climb up on Jordan's chest and just lay there all 16lbs. of him. After awhile of that he would make himself comfortable in his armpit and he would sleep ther all night right next to Jordan. I think that the thing that I will always find the most amazing about our cat was he was our angel. Romeo would come and plop himself down right in between us when we were fighting and just talk to us in that language that wasn't a meow but it wasn't english. I wll never be able to explain how he communicated with us but he did and it will never be matched. He would just sit there in between us and look from one to the other and purr and talk and rub and nudge. He was always the one that would reconcile us and now we are forever reconciled to the realization that he is gone. I just want to apologize to my husband for my lack of courage and not being able to wrap him up, I know that it must have been terrible for you and I am so sorry for that. I just really want to thankyou for your heart and sensitivity to me. I love you. Jordan wrapped him up and we took him out and buried him. Jordan, Reston, Hannah, Cela, Jessica and myself drove out to the desert last night and buried him next to a beautiful verde tree. I have never in my life missed something more than Romeo beside my family that is gone. I just really hope that in his last breaths he knew that I loved him and how much I am going to miss him. Lord I just thankyou for the blessing that Romoeo was in my life and everyone that had a chance to meet him and see what a wonderful creature he was. I just pray that you would make the transition easy and the grief short. Fill the void that is there with your love and peace. Thankyou Jesus.

If If you can keep your head when all about you Are losing theirs and blaming it on you; If you can trust yourself when all men doubt you, But make allowance for their doubting too; If you can wait and not be tired by waiting, Or being lied about, don't deal in lies, Or being hated, don't give way to hating, And yet don't look too good, nor talk too wise: If you can dream -- and not make dreams your master; If you can think -- and not make thoughts your aim; If you can meet with Triumph and Disaster And treat those two imposters just the same; If you can bear to hear the truth you've spoken Twisted by knaves to make a trap for fools, Or watch the things you gave your life to, broken, And stoop and build them up with worn-out tools; If you can make a heap of all your winnings And risk it on one turn of pitch-and-toss, And lose, and start again at your beginnings And never breathe a word about your loss; If you can force your heart and nerve and sinew To serve your turn long after they are gone, And so hold on when there is nothing in you Except the Will which says to them: "Hold on!" If you can talk with crowds and keep your virtue, Or walk with kings -- nor lose the common touch, If neither foes nor loving friends can hurt you, If all men count with you, but none too much; If you can fill the unforgiving minute With sixty seconds worth of distance run -- Yours is the Earth and everything that's in it, And -- which is more -- you'll be a Man, my son! Rudyard Kipling

Wear the beauty of Christ as this sister does and so make the father in heaven pleased with your willing and open heart. Welcome your brother Britt as a dear family member. He has faithfully served me and so many young adults with his music and song. In Britt you have a disciplined leader who in concerned about an attention to detail that is necessary for the church to run smoothly. Your brother Britt is humble and meek, yet smart and able to lead others in both the workplace and in the church. You all should aspire to have a spirit of service such as Britt has. Bless him for the many ways he has blessed the church. Also, welcome your sister Kristi - who has endured much persecution at work for her faithfulness in serving the young in Jesus name. She has dedicated herself to building the community and receving the tithes and offerings for the work of Jesus Christ. We all should be looking at such needs and seeking to fill them as she has done. Let her model of faith and love for the brothers and sisters be immitated by all who read this letter. Receive with love your new sisters and brothers from the East Valley church. They bring great spiritual giftings and a genuine concern and love for all the saints. Greet Obadiah with blessings and a holy kiss. I have known him and worked by his side for over three years now and know his commitment to the cause of Christ. He has been tired and worked faithfully and a season of rest is due him. I know the time is coming, and we look forward to his rest so that he might come back to us energized with a new passion and purpose. He has read the word of God deeply and has much spiritual insight to give to you so that you might find yourself approved on the day of the judgement of the Lord. Young men, you too should model his steadfastness in following the Lord - even to the point of exhaustion. There is time for rest, as Obadiah will be getting soon, but there is also a time for going to war - and he has been in just such a war for the last few years. I want you to pay special attention to my sister in the Lord named Jen. She is faithful and true - a model of youth serving God faithfully. You too should try to model a beauty that comes from the inside like this sister. She is completely capable but she is not proud. She has a swift mind, but she does not use it to tear down like some mongrels of the word - who seek to use the word to bring down other brothers and sister. How do you win back the trust of someone you hurt? Someone who's business is none of yours? How do you show her that you aren't just out to be right but instead that you love her unconditionally even when she may not say the right things or make the right decisions. When is the age that we start respecting her as a person and not a child that needs to be under a thumb. When do we realize that she has feelings too and no matter how right you thought you were you were wrong. How do you make her realize that just because you are a leader does not mean you are her parent. I think that there is a fine line that we have to walk. I understand that there are certain things that we HAVE to do and say. However there are things that are not our place. We have to be above reproach and blameless but to try and make her feel that we are above her is absolutely the wrong thing to do. She doesn't want an authority in you even though sometimes you need to be that she was looking for a friend. When you can get to a place with her that you are her friend you find richness in her that can not be found anywhere else. We realize that we underestimate the deepness in her eyes and her soul. We understand that the questions that she has are deep if not more deep than the crap we contemplate. You don't get to experience that deepness if you wound her. When you are young and struggling to begin with wounds take even longer to heal and bitterness tends to fester, and, without notice you find out that all of that is directed at you and what you didn't do for her when she needed it the most. The reason she needs it is because at this time in her life she feels like a lot of people that tell her they love her are turning on her. Then to top it all off she goes to someone else and tells them what you did to her and how she has lost respect for you because what you thought was the best for her was really the best that you selfishly wanted. She tells you she thinks that you try to hard and it's pathetic. You cringe but you listen because that is what they need at that exact moment in time. She doesn't need someone to tell her their opinion or share what they think and are feeling she doesn't want to hear it. The hardest thing on top of all of this is that you agree, you have this feeling of disgust because you can relate to being hurt the same way by that same person. The attitude of being better than everyone has been shown to you too by that person and you swallow the lump in your throat. You really don't know what to say because how do you tell her you feel the same way. How do you tell her that the person is nosy in your life too, that they don't know how to just stop, that they are always trying to prove you wrong and in a sense make you feel dumb. How do you tell her that? You don't because that would be even more wrong than what they did to her. Then you really think about it and you realize that you really don't care. You don't care that that person is the way that they are because you have your own issues that you need to deal with before you can point out anyone else's faults. So instead you look at her and tell her you love her and that if she needs someone to talk to you are there and you leave it at that. Then you go inside grieved that this person is causing people to be discouraged and hurt and you try and figure out what needs to happen. You can't though because just as much as it wasn't that person's place to do what they did to her it's not your responsibility to "fix" that person, God will do that on His own without your help. So you trust and hope that it will be soon because they are and have hurt a lot of people and all it does is continue.

I have been reading C.S.Lewis' "The Great Divorce" and it has been very interesting . The imagery and approach that he takes on and towards certain things. He explains things through his character's in a way that you might not usually look at something. His approaches tend to very random and off the wall but when you really analyze it and try and think about it practically it makes complete sense. Some of the scenes in the book are cut short due to narrator moving on in his own journey but your imagination takes off and you begin to, in you own mind, complete what would have happened. Obviously just like any other piece of literature that I have read quotes, thoughts, and issues stand out. In one of the scenes the ghost(the people who are in hell given a second chance at heaven) is talking to a spirit(a person who realized the err of their ways before death and made it to heaven the first time) are talking. This particular ghost was in his mortal life a scholar/writer of amazing pieces of work on earth. The spirit is trying to convince the ghost that the land that he will enter if he chooses is one of eternal answers and the ghost is arguing that there is no one definitive answer to anything including who or what God is. The ghost is basically stuck on the idea of status because of who he once was and after a long drawn out conversation the spirit sums it up in one response. "No," said the spirit. "I can promise you none of those things. No sphere of usefulness: you are not needed at all. No scope for your talents: only the forgiveness for having perverted them. No atmosphere of inquiry, for I will bring you to the land not of questions but of answers, and you shall see the face of God." To think that God gives us life on earth and fills our life with grace and gifts that we can use to spread them to other's. Once we leave this place however we are of no need. I will not be useful in heaven. I will not be needed in heaven. I will though be wanted and desired by a loving God. The talents that I have been given by only Him alone are His to give and take. Since I have them though, how have I used them? Have I become prideful because I have a voice that can sing? Have I become prideful because I have fingers to play? Have I become prideful because I have legs and arms to use for physical activities? The answer to all of them is most likely whether I admit or accept it, yes. That is an example of the perversion that was spoken of. To think though that in the end when it all comes down to it God forgives me for not using those talents, those gifts for His glory all of the time. When I have fallen into that pridefulness God looks at me and says, "Don't forget where those came from." When it comes to questions and answers I think of all the conversations that I have had with people and the discussions that most often have ended in frustration. The hours that have been wasted on discussions about what everyone thinks scripture is saying is incredible. I have come to a place, I think, where scripture tends to be extremely black and white in more areas than this world and the church have determined. There is not a whole lot of gray area. I know that the only way to the Father is through the Son. I know that I have been redeemed from death because of the cross. I know that the righteousness that the Son possesses dwells in me. I know that I am cleansed by the blood of the lamb. And I know that I am forgiven of my sins. As far as predestination and pre-trib/post-trib those might very well be gray areas however, what does it matter? There is not atmosphere of inquiry because there will not be a need or persistence for answers because you will know beyond a shadow of doubt what the answers were all along. At that moment you might actually smack yourself in the head, duh. You might even realized that it had been in front of you the entire time but the complexity of man confused and distorted it, and you might just realize how simple it really was. However, none of these things may occur because you will be before the throne of the Almighty and that is really all that will matter. more to come.............................................

By and by and through the years things you've taught me through the years my whole life was designed by you I'll never know anyone half as true. God knows the beginning from the end, He knew the beginning before it was the beginning. Just like us I think that God remembers the times that He has had with us. We take pictures and hang them on the walls of our houses and rooms, we put them in frames and sit them on our desks at work and in book cases in the hallway. I find myself looking at the pictures that I have pasted all over my cube at work and remember the day the hour the minute of that moment that will never be repeated. I think about the beauty in Stephen as he stood on the chair and listened to Seventh Day Slumber with the sun setting in front of him. I look at Adoniah with the drool running down her chin and the smile of innocence as she stares at a wildflower. I am again caught in the moment of the day that I married Jordan, the joy and happiness is indescribable. The walls of heaven are no different every moment of our lives are hanging on those walls from beginning to end. My mother the day that she found out that she was carrying me, the excitement and fear in her eyes. My first breath as I entered the world, my first word, my first step all of those are in a frame on those walls. I know it is common practice to take pictures of the moments that are happy and joyful and momentous. We take pictures when we want to think back on the fun of that day, like the picture that I have of all the youth group leaders piled in a Walmart shopping cart. What about those times though that you want to forget but need to look back on sometimes to realize how blessed you are. Do those pictures hang on the walls of heaven too??? The day that Mandy passed out in the car and Ben thought that he was losing her? The days and weeks that Joey withered away from kidney failure with his family grieving the inevitable? The days that Melissa cried for the 2 miscarried babies that she desired with everything in her? The day that my stomach was pumped because whether I knew it at the time or not I was trying to leave this world because I couldn't handle it? Are there pictures of those? I would like to think not because why would you want to have pictures to remind you of those times? Deep down though I think there are, I think those pictures hang on the walls of triumph. God revels in those pictures because he looks and sees promise, He sees deliverance, He sees redemption, He sees His child overcoming. I think that those pictures might be treasured just as much if not more than the ones of constant happiness and jubilee. He treasures them because He knows that the reason for His son was that exactly. It makes the pain and misery that His son endured completely and absolutely worth it all. His countenance shines on us now because we can look back on that and give Him all the glory for those moments because in the end there is triumph, happiness, joy, fun, love, and grace beyond compare. Mandy is still here, Joey has gone home and knows pain no more, Melissa will have her baby, and I am still here with a purpose. He knows the beginning from the end and in the end of it all we will all serve the Lord with the fervor that we had when we grieved and cried and wanted to give up. We have been given a hope that we need to explain to people and that is why we will go on through the fire and the storms that this world brings against us. We will continue to fight this fight because we have an awesome cheering section and an even more awesome coach who not only stands on the sidelines but gets right in there with us with mud up to His elbows because He knows and is not afraid. He knows the beginning from the end.

Samantha wears this bracelet that her mother gave her. This is the first gift in the last 5 years that Rachel, her mother, has given her that did not come with come gross expectation. The gross expectation had always and still does at times consist of near perfection. Why? Sam has never been able to answer that question and doesn't think that she ever will. Maybe, someday ten even fifteen years down the road she will know why, as for right now however she doesn't bother giving any effort to the question. The question plagued her for almost 5 years and that plague didn't get her anywhere except traveling the road of feeling like a constant failure. As of right now she contemplates the bracelet. Rachel was never known to be a woman of profound thought or idea so it makes the bracelet even more of a mystery. It is made of pewter and is actually an extremely beautiful piece. The bracelet consists of your regular jewelry accesories such as a clasp and rings that usually in the end get caught on something and pull open. You grab the pliers and squeeze them back together, good as new right? The bracelet also has 7 charms on it which is the first interesting thing that Sam noticed. Seven of course is the number of perfection which makes the whole thing kind of ironic. Like that song by Alannis Morrisette, man get's on a plane for the first time and it crashes, that kind of ironic. The charms have words engraved in them on both sides. The first time Sam really looked at the charms she was intrigued by the word that was on the top compared to the word that was on the bottom depending on how you wore it. The first one and on down the line has Hope and Courage, Love and Humor, Trust and Kindness, Joy and Honor, Family and Passion, Truth and Unity, and lastly Loyalty and Charity. These make up the gift that was given from her mother. Sam just kind of thought that the correllation of the words was not a very common one in most of the cases. The ones that she found to be more unusual than the others was hope and courage. Sam like most Americans heard on the news, radios, and newspapers about Pat Tillman. The pro football player that gave up millions of dollars to do something that he exceeded at, a sport that he had played in highschool and college. He turned down the Vikings and signed with the Cardinals, insane right? Even more insane was when he told the Cardinals that he was going to war. He was going to go fight a battle that was not his to fight but he thought differently. He did not want to be a hero, he didn't even want to make a big deal about it but the media got a hold of that one and wrapped it's greedy little fist around it. He was corageous and when Sam thought about corageousness she also thought bravery, fierceness, determination, fearlessness, lion-heartedness, and heroism. The last thing that Sam thought was hope. Hope was always something bigger that a person possessed. Sam always associated this with achievement, ambition, aspiration, dreams, and belief. After really thinking about it though doing what he did had to have some kind of sentimentality to it. Pat Tillman believed in something that most Americans didn't and don't. He believed in something a whole lot bigger than himself, he had a dream for the country that his future children would dwell. He was a genuine hero. Sam was perplexed with the ideas that her mind was filled with due to this gift, the bracelet from her mother. The idea of believing that she could be fearless in endeavors that she faced was almost, in her weak faltering mind, ungraspable. To be determined in achievement and ambition is something that after thinking about it has always came naturally to her. She is stubborn and pig-headed and she is rarely known to back down from anything in her face. She may not be the most eloquent about it at times but she refuses to be taken advantage of or hurt. Maybe this is where the other charm comes into the picture, trust and kindness. Sam for a long time before Jeff had an issue with trusting anyone especially men and family had turned their back on her in her deepest need so she had little trust for them as well. So, naturally kindness did not come easily either. It took Sam a long time not to immediately doubt the motives of everyone in her life. She always assumed that if someone was trying to get close to her they wanted something from her and often times she let them in and they tapped her dry. Trust and kindness were not attritbutes that she possessed just because, she had to work at it for an extended period of time and she still fine tunes them daily. Jeff has changed that in her since those days, he has shown her what real trust, honesty, and kindness is really all about. He has also shown her what true love means, not the sappy drippy love that you see in movies but real live, raw, in your face true love. Since marrying Jeff she has redefined in her reality what family is. Family and passion have merged to become something that is so beautiful that at times she can barely take it. She has learned and seen what unconditional love from man looks like. When she felt unlovable it was at that moment that Jeff told her just how much he cherished having her in his life. When she felt detestable Jeff told her that she was blessing from God. When she felt unattractive and fat and that her face looked like a land mine because she was on her period and all broke out Jeff told her she was the most incredible creature he had ever laid eyes on. The look in his eyes and the touch of his fingertips enlightened Sam to a passion that she had never experienced. Their physical intimacy was powerful and the way that he makes love to her opened her eyes to his selflessness. She may not be the best at telling him or communicating that to him but she knows he knows. Don't get me wrong there are times where the sparks have flown and things were said that shouldn't have been said but Jeff is her friend before anything else and that is why their love works. Sam laughs more with Jeff than any other man ever. His sense of humor is what makes them the best pair because there are times where he doesn't need to say a thing and Sam is in tears from laughter. Humor and love come hand in hand. If you can't have fun with the person you love than you really don't know what you are missing. Sam's experience with humor before Jeff with other men was always at her expense. The expense of her feelings, her emotions, and mostly her self-esteem. Back in the day the tears that fell from her eyes were not from laughter or happiness or even love, it was contempt, sadness, and depression. Now Sam and Jeff have a love that they can wrap their hands around and control because of loyalty they both have towards the sanctity of marriage. Sam always compared every act of loyalty and charity to her father Brad. Sam will look you sqaure in the eye and tell you her father is one of the most loyal people that you will ever meet. Brad is and always has been the type of husband, father, and friend that would do whatever it took to make anything work. When Rachel cheated on him after 13 years of marriage he suggested counseling, a trial separation, even moving to a different state to try and put back together what obviously had fallen apart. When Sam was 16 and making some really stupid choices he did all the typical things that a father did to get his oldest daughter back on track. When that didn't work he offered counseling individually and together but Sam didn't want anything to do with it. She turned her back on him and left him with no choice but to move her back to Arizona with her mother Rachel but he didn't give up restoring what was broken. Today Brad and Sam are closer as a father an daughter than they ever were. Sam calls her dad and they talk for hours about everything from weather to baseball to what is going on with Sam's marriage and life in general. Loyalty has always been at the top of Brad's list when it came to his family especially his girls. That is where Sam got it from. She struggled with it because for a long time she wasn't shown any by anyone or anything in her existance. Today she not only tries hard to be loyal to people and commitments but she strives to be charitable as well. She opens her home to friends and family to just spend an afternoon together and eat and fellowship. She struggles with charity in her finances but she works on it daily. Loyalty and charity has always been to characteristics that Sam has tried to acquire in her life. The bracelet that Sam has spent many minutes maybe even hours thinking about and looking at. It has evolved from it's original form the first time that she put it on her wrist. It still is a bracelet but it has become so much more to Sam. This jewelry has become and idea maybe even an action if put in motion. Sam still will wonder about the bracelet. She will wonder why out of all the things that her mother could have given her why something like that at a time and a place where she is at right now.

Embarking on a journey that I have traveled before. Traveling a road that I know the bumps and curves. The sway of the trees and the stories they tell. The sunshine in their faces that my skin has missed desperately. The laughter in the flowers and the voices in the wind. I know this road like the veins that riddle the palm of my hand. I know the movement of the life on this road like the blood running through my veins. The bumps were harsh and difficult. My pride and selfish wanting were the hardest to break. The jealousy and hurt of not seeing the green of the island was enough to cry a river. But the bumps in this road were worth it. Tangled in the bramble and fighting out was a battle to be told. I have emerged a refreshed vessel, ready again to be filled with the work of someone other than myself. It will be different and new. It's will be like tasting the nectar of the vine for the first time. Like the nourishment of a mother's breast. The hand of the Father around my heart ready once again to mold it to His plan. He waited patiently as I dealt with my sin. He dealt with my fists pounding on His chest. He wiped the tears from my eyes the day Isaac was gone. In my yearnings and through the storm He once again calmed the seas. Patience can be a gift and a curse when it is not channeled properly. I have experienced both worlds of that patience during this time and I have learned. I am excited to follow this road again. To watch Him unfold in everything and everyone. Lord have me as I return, the prodigal daughter.
